supplement.translation[0].definitions[0]: something that you add to something else to improve it or make it complete
The payments are a supplement to his usual salary.
supplement.translation[0].definitions[1]: an additional part at the end of a book, or a separate part of a newspaper, magazine etc
supplement.translation[0].definitions[2]: an amount of money that is added to the price of a service, hotel room etc
Single rooms are available at a supplement.
supplement.translation[1].definitions[0]: to add something, especially to what you earn or eat, in order to increase it to an acceptable level
Kia supplements her regular salary by tutoring in the evenings.
supplement.translation[2].definitions[0]: to add something to something to make it more successful, useful, or complete
The acquisition will supplement their business strategy to produce higher-margin products.
As the number of farmers falls, many are seeking new outlets to supplement their incomes.
The staff handbooks will be supplemented with a series of workshops.
supplement.translation[3].definitions[0]: something you add to make something better, more useful, or more complete
Thewelfare supplement is payable to employees who retire between Nov. 1 and Dec. 31.
The informal discussion groups are a good supplement to the overall training program.
supplement.translation[3].definitions[1]: an additional part of a book, newspaper, report etc
The actual amount of commission is only disclosed in a supplement to the firm’s prospectus.
supplement.translation[3].definitions[2]: a sum of money added to the price of service, such as a hotel room or plane journey
There is a single room supplement of £10 per night.
